name: Spicy Lime Avocado Soup
description: My husband tried to tell me not to submit this recipe... he doesn't want the whole world to know about it, but I say share what you have! Serve with warm tortilla chips and a nice large mojito. Top with sour cream or creme fraiche if desired.
recipeIngredient: 2 jalapeno peppers, halved and thinly sliced
3 large firm-ripe avocados, cut into chunks
¼ cup crumbled queso fresco, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add chicken; boil until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 7 minutes. Drain.
Run cool water over chicken to speed cooling process. Shred or finely slice chicken.
Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add 1/2 onion, lime juice, 1/2 cup cilantro, jalapeno peppers, and garlic until onion is slightly greenish in color, about 5 minutes.
Combine 4 cups water and bouillon powder in a small bowl. Pour into the pot. Let cook until just heated through, about 5 minutes. Stir chicken into the pot.
Ladle soup into 4 bowls. Top with remaining 1/2 onion, 1/2 cup cilantro, avocado, and queso fresco.

review.reviewBody: This was a delicious soup! Made it mostly following the instructions. Didn’t really add anything different. However I did use my instant pot so the order of cooking was a little different. I sautéed the onions and then added the garlic after the onions were nearly done. Then I added a little or Oregano And sautéed a little longer. I deglaze the pot with a little white wine.  I then added the 4 cups of water and the chicken soup base. I threw in two frozen clump together chicken breasts from Costco. I cook these for 25 minutes and then did natural release for 15 minutes. Took the meat out and shredded it threw it back in the pot added all the rest of the ingredients and it was amazing! Thank you thank you for sharing this recipe.
very delicious I used my own chicken stock vs boullion. I used precooked chicken so it was super fast and great. Thank you for posting this:)

I make this often with different colored bell peppers and lots of onions sauteed with chili powder and cumin blooming the spices. I add fresh tomatoes at the end and all the different colors are amazing. We call this tortilla soup and squeeze a bit of lime to go with the avocado for serving. It's a very healthy soup! Thanks for posting!

Ahhhhhmazing!!!  I put this up there as a Tie for #1 with a Chicken Tortilla Soup I found here on AllRecipes.  Minimal  changes made is I used already cooked shredded xcken the store makes out of the rotisseries that don't sell (helps with added flavor and also laziness),  I completely de-seeded the peppers just in case (will not do so next time for more spice) and I think my garlic cloves and large onion must have been really large because I didn't use all of them.   Wouldn't change a thing!  Thank you for not listening to your husband and sharing.  This is a keeper for sure - and I will always give due credit to SerenaBloom and AR =)  No pic as it was gone before the flash went off.

Easy, flavorful, I make mine spicier, matter of choice. Use rotisserie or left over chicken added at the end to save time. Breast meat is too dry for us. Used my own chicken broth but a good store bought one is good too, unsalted so you can control it. Don't know why one reviewer said it took ALL day! A bit of chopping but...we love lots of cilantro  & garlic and you can spice it up anyway you want. Thanks this is great!
This is amazing. I'm not a big soup lover but I will definitely be making this again. The flavors work so well together!
Simple but full of flavor! Right before eating I added some crushed tortilla chips to each bowl. Thanks for sharing your recipe!

This is a keeper/make again recipe! Delicious and very healthy.  Don’t fail to add the toppings of fresh cut pieces of not too soft avocado, chopped onion, fresh cilantro and the crumbled cheese (I found and used the kind specified at While Foods).  Toppings add even more interest and texture to the delicious soup. I appreciated the comments to not use overly dry chicken – – even though the chicken is in soup, moist pulled or cubed chicken is best. Thank you for this refreshing and tasty recipe!
Perfect! Next time I may top with a few tortilla chips for texture.

Too much lime and as another reviewer said not enough body. I added lots of other ingredients including garlic cumin another chicken cube black pepper mushrooms fajita seasoning and pepper to step it up. It was good with the additions but I didn't find the avocado added much to compliment the sour in the recipe.
